definition: to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: Just like that, I could feel her in my arms.
sentences.chinese: 就像字面意思那樣，我能夠感覺到她在我的懷抱中。

sentences.english: The manufacturers in Mainland China are eager to adopt the products of Media Tek and MStar Semiconductor.
sentences.chinese: 而中國廠家則迫不及待地投入聯發科和晨星的懷抱。

sentences.english: When I saw the blue, I can not wait into the embrace of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 當看到那片蔚藍色時，我迫不及待地投入到它的懷抱。

sentences.english: The South Korean puppet regime must return my daughter to her mother's arms right away.
sentences.chinese: 韓國傀儡政權必須馬上送還我的女兒到母親的懷抱。

sentences.english: I must go down to the seas again, to the vagrant Gypsy life.
sentences.chinese: 我必須重回大海的懷抱，回到浪跡天涯的無拘生活。

sentences.english: And an autumn reflection , will deliver me to your arms.
sentences.chinese: 而一副秋日的倒影，將把我領入你的懷抱。

sentences.english: Then she gave a deep sight and snuggled into my arms.
sentences.chinese: 接着她深深嘆口氣，緊緊的偎依在我的懷抱裏。

sentences.english: Little girl, you go on dancing in your new friend's arms.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘，你在新友的懷抱裏繼續跳舞。

sentences.english: An enormous iceberg nestles into an ice shelf in Antarctica.
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的冰山依偎在南極冰架的懷抱。

sentences.english: Two completely different fleets are making their way towards the Southern Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 兩支懷抱著完全不同使命的艦隊正朝著南冰洋前進。

sentences.english: John's wife left him for another man.
sentences.chinese: 約翰的妻子舍他而去，投入另一個男子的懷抱。

sentences.english: Blue and white porcelain is broken, five field of the earth return to embrace.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷碎，五方土重歸中華大地懷抱。

sentences.english: She threw herself into his outflung arms.
sentences.chinese: 她投入他那雙臂張開的懷抱。

sentences.english: Then with a heart of gratefulness, everything turns out to be gorgeous.
sentences.chinese: 然後，懷抱感恩的心去生活，一切都將會變得美好。

sentences.english: Children were rent from their mothers'arms by the brutal soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 兇暴的士兵強使孩子離開母親的懷抱。

sentences.english: Children were rent from their mothers' arms by the brutal soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 兇暴的士兵強使孩子們離開他們母親的懷抱。

definition: bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
